name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is Joe Biden’s pick for vice president. In July, @IsaacDovere wrote that if she were the pick, it would “probably seem like the longest, most drawn-out lead-up to an obvious conclusion in the history of modern presidential politics.” https://t.co/DUN5WK1y0m

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris is officially the Democratic vice-presidential candidate. @PeterBeinart writes that Harris’s tough-on-crime record says “less about her than about the country in which she lived.”  https://t.co/QEDvH3YIgp

name: TheAtlantic
text: Is Mars overstudied? No, but plenty of other planets (and moons) in our solar system are also worthy of attention, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/gEiN9W4X3y

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden’s running mate, Kamala Harris, is two decades younger than him—the potential vice presidency seems like merely a first step, @IsaacDovere writes. https://t.co/TG60BKbOMM

name: TheAtlantic
text: "All these lights started going off." @arielsabar talks with @amyweissmeyer about the stranger-than-fiction story of a Harvard professor, a con artist, and a papyrus fragment that made front-page news: https://t.co/kd3NsH4Yn7

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: QAnon got closer to Congress tonight. To understand this phenomenon, read the definitive investigation:
https://t.co/VA6RTP1gTd

name: TheAtlantic
text: Kamala Harris will be waging her vice-presidential campaign within a culture that is happy to allow women their place—as long as they know their place. @megangarber writes: https://t.co/vlAb9ECj70

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YAppelbaum: It's the third anniversary of the Unite the Right rally in Charlottesville. In its aftermath, Joe Biden wrote this essay for The Atlantic: "If it wasn’t clear before, it’s clear now: We are living through a battle for the soul of this nation.”

https://t.co/YA1MSUtx92

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Republicans wanted to limit voter turnout and raise doubts about the election’s integrity, creating chaos within the Postal Service and undermining its independence would be an efficient way to pursue that goal," Winifred Gallagher writes: https://t.co/3Ttq8bYu8V

name: TheAtlantic
text: As the co-founder of an NYC tutoring company, @bplatzer has been fielding calls every day from desperate parents struggling to figure out how to help their kids this school year and wondering whether they should set up a pod. This is what he tells them: https://t.co/Yc8yvouNQ6

name: TheAtlantic
text: Harris's nomination as vice president "may be remembered as a moment when the pinnacle of Democratic Party leadership came to more closely resemble the base of voters that elects it to power," @RonBrownstein writes: https://t.co/9I7BRiJutO

name: TheAtlantic
text: Britain has suffered the worst death toll in Europe—but the country's failures go beyond Boris Johnson. It was sick long before the coronavirus struck, @TomMcTague writes: https://t.co/ovn54eM52o

name: TheAtlantic
text: Teachers discuss whether it’s safe to reopen schools this fall, via @TheAtlLetters: https://t.co/T1uIWajO1q

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden has welcomed progressive input in his campaign. Lefty activists are hoping Kamala Harris, his vice-presidential nominee, will be just as flexible, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/yZUdT8bUxP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: "Harris makes the concept of Biden as a bridge more concrete ... by embodying the other side of that span: a party that potentially makes more room at the table for people who look like her." Always read @RonBrownstein https://t.co/VFwZizCP4C

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @nora_kelly: Today's "Well, actually ... " moment from @elainejgodfrey: https://t.co/jKuk7eo9q1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Pop culture can’t imagine a female vice president like Kamala Harris, @megangarber argues: https://t.co/QYFCPPlc2h

name: TheAtlantic
text: Fever checks are being widely ordered as schools and offices reopen. But passing them shouldn't be taken as evidence that you're not spreading the virus, writes @jameshamblin. https://t.co/c374WVxwWk

name: TheAtlantic
text: "There is ample reason to worry that the outgoing Trump administration will disregard the laws and the norms that are supposed to govern the transition period," @RebeccaLissner writes: https://t.co/qufuXlGBOn

name: TheAtlantic
text: Joe Biden has welcomed progressive input in his campaign. Lefty activists are hoping Kamala Harris, his vice-presidential nominee, will be just as flexible, @elainejgodfrey reports: https://t.co/vBFe84LSJf
